## Description {#details}

This class wraps a std::error&#95;code in a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>.

This is useful if you&#39;re writing an interface that returns a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> (or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected</a>) and you want to call code that still returns std::error&#95;codes.

Definition at line 1179 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### convertToErrorCode() {#a69ac5f81e50fff903cf3edae2084c266}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::ECError::convertToErrorCode () const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Convert this error to a std::error&#95;code.

This is a temporary crutch to enable interaction with code still using std::error&#95;code. It will be removed in the future.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l01186">1186</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.
